intro: Patinoa almirajo, commonly known as the Almirajo plant, is a flowering species native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
